presentation_title: Doughlicious: Crafting Joy, One Gourmet Cookie at a Time

title_slide.title: Doughlicious: Crafting Joy, One Gourmet Cookie at a Time

slides.title: Cookie Fatigue
slides.body:
• The market is filled with mass-produced, artificial cookies.
• Local bakeries offer quality but lack convenience and scale.
• Consumers crave unique, high-quality treats that feel special.
slides.image_prompt: A supermarket aisle with generic, plastic-wrapped cookie packages under harsh fluorescent lighting, looking unappetizing.
slides.title: The Problem
slides.body:
• Climate change creates unpredictable growing seasons for farmers.
• Water scarcity and rising costs threaten farm profitability.
• Traditional methods miss early signs of crop stress and disease.
slides.image_prompt: Dramatic split-screen photo showing a drought-stricken cornfield on one side and a perfectly healthy, green field on the other, cinematic color grading.

slides.title: Our Solution
slides.body:
• Artisanal, small-batch cookies with rotating, seasonal flavors.
• A seamless tech-first experience for online ordering and delivery.
• A warm, inviting brand that builds community and delight.
slides.image_prompt: A modern, bright bakery counter with a friendly barista handing a beautiful branded box of cookies to a smiling customer.

slides.title: Market Opportunity
slides.body:
• TAM: $62B Global Confectionery Market.
• SAM: $11B US Gourmet Cookie & Snack Market.
• SOM: $5M Target in 3 major cities in Year 1.
slides.image_prompt: An infographic-style illustration showing three concentric circles representing TAM, SAM, and SOM with clean, modern icons.

slides.title: Gourmet Flavors
slides.body:
• We use premium ingredients like Valrhona chocolate and local dairy.
• Our menu features unique monthly drops to drive repeat visits.
slides.image_prompt: Stunning macro shot of a freshly baked sea salt chocolate chip cookie, warm light, a wisp of steam rising, on a rustic wooden board.

slides.title: Revenue Streams
slides.body:
• Direct-to-Consumer: In-store sales and local online delivery.
• Corporate Gifting: Branded boxes for client and employee appreciation.
• Catering & Events: Custom orders for parties and gatherings.

slides.title: Why We Win
slides.body:
• Superior Product: Unforgettable taste from premium ingredients.
• Strong Brand: A lifestyle brand focused on joy and connection.
• Tech-Enabled: Efficient operations and a frictionless customer app.

colors.body:
AgriSense is an AI platform that delivers real-time, actionable insights to farmers.

• Optimize water usage by up to 30% with precise irrigation schedules.
• Predict crop yields with 95% accuracy to improve planning.
• Detect diseases and pests weeks earlier than the human eye.

colors.title: How It Works
colors.body:
• We integrate satellite, drone, and on-field sensor data.
• Our proprietary AI models analyze this data for key insights.
colors.image_prompt: Clean, futuristic infographic diagram showing icons for a satellite, a drone, and a soil sensor feeding data into a central cloud AI brain, which then outputs insights to a farmer's tablet. Use a clean, minimalist style.

colors.title: Market Opportunity
colors.body:
• $24B Global Precision Agriculture market by 2028 (TAM).
• $8B market for AI-driven farm management in North America (SAM).
• $500M initial target for vineyards and high-value crops (SOM).
colors.image_prompt: Stylized 3D map of North America with glowing data points concentrated over major agricultural zones like California's Central Valley and the Midwest Corn Belt.

colors.title: Business Model
colors.body:
A simple tiered SaaS subscription based on acreage managed.

• Starter: $10/acre per year for basic monitoring.
• Pro: $25/acre per year with predictive analytics and alerts.
• Enterprise: Custom pricing for large-scale operations.

colors.title: Competitive Edge
colors.body:
• Our sensor-fusion AI is 40% more accurate than satellite-only rivals.
• We provide actionable recommendations, not just raw data.
• Our platform integrates seamlessly with existing farm equipment.
colors.image_prompt: A modern, sleek dashboard on a tablet screen showing farm health metrics, with a sharp focus on an alert for 'Nitrogen Deficiency Detected'.

colors.title: Competitive Landscape
colors.body:
• Planet Labs ($2.2B market cap, 200+ satellites) - Provides raw imagery, lacks farm-level insights | Our advantage: We translate data into actionable irrigation and fertilizer plans.
• FBN ($3.9B valuation) - Focus on network and inputs, weaker predictive AI | Our advantage: Superior disease prediction models reducing crop loss by 15%.
• CropX ($30M funding) - Hardware-focused on soil sensors | Our advantage: We fuse soil data with aerial imagery for a complete field view.

colors.title: Our Traction
colors.body:
• 50+ pilot farms across 10,000 acres in California.
• $120k in ARR achieved in our first 6 months.
• Validated 22% average reduction in water usage.
colors.image_prompt: Clean, simple bar chart with a steep upward trend labeled 'Acres Under Management', showing growth from 0 to 10,000 over three quarters.

colors.title: Customer Proof
colors.body:
"AgriSense saved our vineyard. We caught a fungal outbreak a month early and saved the entire harvest."

- Maria Garcia, Owner, Napa Valley Vineyards
colors.image_prompt: Golden hour photograph of a sun-drenched vineyard, with lush green grapevines stretching into the distance. The photo feels warm and successful.

colors.title: Our Team
colors.body:
• Dr. Elena Petrova, CEO - PhD in Remote Sensing, ex-NASA JPL.
• Ben Carter, CTO - Led AgTech division at John Deere for 10 years.
• Samuel Jones, Head of Growth - Scaled two SaaS startups past $10M ARR.
• Chloe Nguyen, Lead Agronomist - 15 years of field experience with UC Davis.

colors.title: The Ask
colors.body: We are raising a $2.5M seed round to scale our sales team, expand sensor integrations, and achieve nationwide coverage.

colors.title: Customer Love
colors.body:
• 10k+ waitlist signups pre-launch.
• 4.9 star rating from our initial pop-up events.
colors.image_prompt: A beautiful collage of Instagram posts and glowing customer reviews about cookies, arranged in a clean, modern grid.

colors.title: Competitive Edge
colors.body:
• Crumbl Cookies ($1B+ sales) - Limited weekly rotation, quality concerns | Our advantage: Artisanal quality with greater flavor diversity.
• Insomnia Cookies (Acquired by Krispy Kreme) - Focus on late-night delivery | Our advantage: Premium daytime and corporate gifting focus.

colors.title: Growth Strategy
colors.body:
• Launch flagship store and build a strong local following.
• Expand delivery zones and partner with corporate clients.
• Introduce a national shipping program in Year 2.
colors.image_prompt: A minimalist map of a city with pins dropping in key neighborhoods, illustrating a delivery expansion strategy.

colors.title: Founding Team
colors.body:
• Elena Garcia, CEO & Head Baker - classically trained pastry chef, formerly at Tartine Bakery.
• David Chen, COO - 10 years in logistics and operations at DoorDash.
• Aisha Mohammed, CMO - Scaled brand marketing for direct-to-consumer food startup Sweetgreen.

colors.title: Financial Outlook
colors.body:
• Projecting $1.2M in revenue in Year 1 with one location.
• Scaling to $8M ARR by Year 3 with multi-city expansion.
• Targeting 25% EBITDA margin at scale through operational efficiency.
colors.image_prompt: A simple, elegant bar chart showing projected revenue growth over three years, using the presentation's color palette.

colors.title: Our Ask
colors.body:
• We are raising $750,000 in seed funding.
• Funds will be used for: 40% Flagship Store Build-Out, 35% Marketing & Branding, and 25% Operational Headcount.

style.title: Future Vision
style.body:
• To become the essential OS for every sustainable farm globally.
• Expanding into carbon credit verification and insurance analytics.
• Building a global dataset to model and mitigate climate change impact.
